intro: Dyssodia tenuifolia, commonly known as slenderleaf dyssodia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in dry, arid environments. It features small, narrow leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring. Dyssodia tenuifolia is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
